member.name: T:Ingres.ProviderInternals.XASwitch
member.summary: X/Open XASwitch style methods, but in a .NET environment.

member.summary: XASwitch constructor. Used to start tracing.

member.name: M:Ingres.ProviderInternals.XASwitch.xa_open(System.String,System.Int32,System.Int64)
member.summary: xa_open is called by the transaction manager to initialize the resource manager. This method is called first, before any other xa_ methods are called. xa_open is loaded and called at MSDTC enlistment. It allows MSDTC to test that the connection parameters work while running under the MSDTC user identity and authorization. If there is a problem, we want to know at enlistment time and not at a recovery situation. MSDTC also calls xa_open when it wants to xa_recover and commit/rollback in-doubt transactions. Unfortunately, these connections have different connection parms depending on the recover or commit/rollback. Therefore, we can't re-use the connection and we immediately close the connection after the successful test of the xa_open.
member.param: XA OpenString containing information to connect to the host and database. Max length is 256 characters.

An integer, assigned by the transaction manager, uniquely identifies the called resource manager within the thread of control. The TM passes this rmid on subsequent calls to XA routines to identify the RM. This identifier remains constant until the TM in this thread closes the RM.
TMASYNC if function to be performed async. TMNOFLAGS is no other flags are set.
member.returns: XA_OK for normal execution or an XAER* error code.

member.name: M:Ingres.ProviderInternals.XASwitch.xa_close(System.String,System.Int32,System.Int64)
member.summary: Close the resource manager.
member.param: XA OpenString containing information to connect to the host and database. Max length is 256 characters.

An integer, assigned by the transaction manager, uniquely identifies the called resource manager within the thread of control. The TM passes this rmid on subsequent calls to XA routines to identify the RM. This identifier remains constant until the TM in this thread closes the RM.
TMASYNC if function to be performed async. TMNOFLAGS is no other flags are set.
member.returns: XA_OK for normal execution or an XAER* error code.

member.name: T:Ingres.ProviderInternals.MsgOut.ByteSegOS
member.summary: Class for converting byte stream into segmented output stream. An OutputStreamWriter object is required for conversion of Unicode BLOBs into server character encoded byte streams. OutputStreamWriter requires an IO.Stream to process the resulting byte stream. This class extends IO.Stream to provide segmentation of the converted BLOB, bufferring the stream as needed.

member.summary: Class representing an output stream of bytes (to NetworkStream on the socket).

member.summary: Class constructor for converting byte stream into segmented output stream.

member.name: M:Ingres.ProviderInternals.MsgOut.ByteSegOS.begin(System.Byte)
member.summary: Initialize the segmentor for a new series of BLOB segments. The current message ID must be provided since segmentation of the BLOB may require the current message to be completed and a new message of the same type to be started.

member.name: M:Ingres.ProviderInternals.MsgOut.ByteSegOS.Write(System.Int32)
member.summary: Write a single byte to the segment stream.

member.name: M:Ingres.ProviderInternals.MsgOut.ByteSegOS.Write(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Write a byte sub-array to the segment stream. The remainder of the current message buffer is used to build a segment. When the buffer is filled, the current message is completed and a new message of the same type is started. A non-zero length segment is always left in the current output buffer.
member.param: Number of bytes to be output.

member.name: M:Ingres.ProviderInternals.MsgOut.ByteSegOS.Close
member.summary: Close the output stream.

member.name: M:Ingres.ProviderInternals.MsgOut.ByteSegOS.end
member.summary: End the current output stream of segments. The end-of-segments indicator is appended to the output buffer.

member.name: P:Ingres.Client.IngresConnectionStringBuilder.BlankDate
member.summary: BlankDate=null specifies that an Ingres blank (empty) date result value is to be returned to the application as a null value. The default is to return an Ingres blank date as a DateTime value of "9999-12-31 23:59:59".

member.name: P:Ingres.Client.IngresConnectionStringBuilder.CharacterEncoding
member.summary: Specifies the .NET character encoding (e.g. ISO-8859-1) or code page (e.g. cp1252) to be used for conversions between Unicode and character data types. Generally, the character encoding is determined automatically by the data provider from the Data Access Server installation character set. This keyword allows an alternate character encoding to be specified (if desired) or a valid character encoding to be used if the data provider is unable to map the servers character set.

member.name: P:Ingres.Client.IngresConnectionStringBuilder.ConnectTimeout
member.summary: The time, in seconds, to wait for an attempted connection to time out if the connection has not completed. Default is 15.

member.name: P:Ingres.Client.IngresConnectionStringBuilder.CursorMode
member.summary: Specifies the default cursor concurrency mode, which determines the concurrency of cursors that have no explicitly assigned option in the command text, e.g. "FOR UPDATE" or "FOR READONLY".

member.name: P:Ingres.Client.IngresConnectionStringBuilder.Database
member.summary: Name of the Ingres database being connected to. If a server class is required, use syntax: dbname/server_class

member.name: P:Ingres.Client.IngresConnectionStringBuilder.DateFormat
member.summary: Specifies the Ingres date format to be used by the Ingres server for date literals. Corresponds to the Ingres environment variable II_DATE_FORMAT and is assigned the same values.

member.name: P:Ingres.Client.IngresConnectionStringBuilder.DbmsUser
member.summary: The user name to be associated with the DBMS session. (Equivalent to the Ingres -u flag which can require administrator privileges).

member.name: P:Ingres.Client.IngresConnectionStringBuilder.DbmsPassword
member.summary: The user's DBMS password for the session. (Equivalent to the Ingres -P flag).

member.name: P:Ingres.Client.IngresConnectionStringBuilder.DecimalChar
member.summary: Specifies the character that the Ingres DBMS Server is to use the comma (',') or the period ('.') to separate fractional and non-fractional parts of a number. Default is the period ('.').

member.name: P:Ingres.Client.IngresConnectionStringBuilder.Enlist
member.summary: If set to true and if the creation thread is within a transaction context as established by System.EnterpriseServices.ServicedComponent, the IngresConnection is automatically enlisted into the transaction context. Default is true.

member.name: P:Ingres.Client.IngresConnectionStringBuilder.GroupID
member.summary: Group identifier that has permissions for a group of users.

member.name: P:Ingres.Client.IngresConnectionStringBuilder.MaxPoolSize
member.summary: Maximum number of connections that can be in the pool. Default is 100.

member.name: P:Ingres.Client.IngresConnectionStringBuilder.MinPoolSize
member.summary: Minimum number of connections that can be in the pool. Default is 0.

member.name: P:Ingres.Client.IngresConnectionStringBuilder.MoneyFormat
member.summary: Specifies the Ingres money format to be used by the Ingres server for money literals. Corresponds to the Ingres environment variable II_MONEY_FORMAT and is assigned the same values.

member.name: P:Ingres.Client.IngresConnectionStringBuilder.MoneyPrecision
member.summary: Specifies the money precision to be used by the Ingres server for money literals. Corresponds to the Ingres environment variable II_MONEY_PREC and is assigned the same values.

member.name: P:Ingres.Client.IngresConnectionStringBuilder.Password
member.summary: The password to the Ingres database.

member.name: P:Ingres.Client.IngresConnectionStringBuilder.PersistSecurityInfo
member.summary: Indicate whether password information is returned in a get of the ConnectionString.

member.name: P:Ingres.Client.IngresConnectionStringBuilder.Pooling
member.summary: Enables or disables connection pooling. By default, connection pooling is enabled (true).

member.name: P:Ingres.Client.IngresConnectionStringBuilder.Port
member.summary: Port number on the target server machine that the Data Access Server (DAS) is listening to. Default is "II7".

member.name: P:Ingres.Client.IngresConnectionStringBuilder.RoleID
member.summary: Role identifier that has associated privileges for the role.

member.name: P:Ingres.Client.IngresConnectionStringBuilder.RolePassword
member.summary: Role password associated with the Role ID.

member.name: P:Ingres.Client.IngresConnectionStringBuilder.SendIngresDates
member.summary: If set to true, send DateTime, Date, and Time parameters as ingresdate data type rather than as ANSI timestamp_with_timezone, ANSI date, ANSI time respectively. This option may be used for compatibility with semantic rules from older releases of Ingres. Default is false.

member.name: P:Ingres.Client.IngresConnectionStringBuilder.Server
member.summary: The Ingres server to connect to.

member.name: P:Ingres.Client.IngresConnectionStringBuilder.Timezone
member.summary: Specifies the Ingres time zone associated with the user's location. Used by the Ingres server only. Corresponds to the Ingres environment variable II_TIMEZONE_NAME and is assigned the same values.

member.name: P:Ingres.Client.IngresConnectionStringBuilder.UserID
member.summary: The name of the authorized user connecting to the DBMS Server. This value may be case-sensitive depending on the targer server.

member.name: P:Ingres.Client.IngresConnectionStringBuilder.VnodeUsage
member.summary: Allows the .NET application to control the portions of the vnode information that are used to establish the connection to the remote DBMS server through the Ingres DAS server. Valid options are: "connect" - Only the vnode connection information is used (default). "login" - Both the vnode connection and login information is used.

member.name: P:Ingres.Client.IngresConnectionStringBuilder.IsFixedSize
member.summary: Returns boolean flag indicating whether IngresConnectionStringBuilder has a fixed number of entries.

member.name: M:Ingres.ProviderInternals.MsgConn.#ctor(System.String,System.Byte[]@)
member.summary: Class constructor. Opens a socket connection to target host and initializes the I/O buffers. Sends the DAM-ML connection parameters and returns the response. The DAM-ML connection parameters are formatted as an array of bytes. The byte array reference is provided as the first entry in a multi-dimensional array parameter, msg_cp. The input array reference is sent to the server and the response is placed in a new byte array whose reference is returned in place of the input reference, msg_cp.

member.name: M:Ingres.ProviderInternals.OutBuff.write(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Append a byte array to the output buffer. This routine does not split arrays across buffers, the current buffer is flushed and the array must fit in the new buffer, or an exception is thrown.
member.param: Position of data in array to read from.

member.name: M:Ingres.ProviderInternals.OutBuff.write(Ingres.Utility.InputStream)
member.summary: Append input stream to the output buffer. This routine does not split buffers, the input stream is read until the buffer is filled or the stream is exhausted. The number of bytes read from the input stream is returned. It is the callers responsibility to assure that there is space available in the output buffer.

member.summary: Send buffer to server.

member.summary: Make sure enough room is available in the output buffer for an object of the requested size. If the current buffer is full, it will be flushed and a new DATA message started.
member.returns: True if room is available, false otherwise.
